title: Ticket #7053: Schedd restart counts appear wrong in recent CHTC report
description:
The machine submit-1.chtc.wisc.edu was upgraded to HTCondor 8.9.2 yesterday. After 2 hours, the schedd reported that it was still trying to reconnect to 852 running jobs, even though the JobLeaseDuration for all jobs was 2400 seconds (40 minutes). Now, almost a day later, the count of active reconnects is still 852.

I think the schedd is losing track of reconnect attempts that have concluded.

Here is the full report: 

The schedd submit-1.chtc.wisc.edu restarted at 05/14/19 14:28:16.
It attempted to reconnect to machines where its jobs may still be running.
Here is a summary of the reconnect attempts:

13737 total jobs where reconnecting is possible
852 reconnects are still being attempted
360 reconnects weren't attempted because the lease expired before the schedd restarted
616 reconnects failed
3 reconnects were interrupted by job removal or other event
11906 reconnects succeeded
remarks:
2021-Apr-28 13:27:36 by jfrey:
The restart reconnect counts were greatly improved in HTCONDOR-402.
